ratings.comment: Avoid Zamora! She is very ambiguous when explaining paper and exam guidelines. She is so bad at explaining it that it's like she wants you to do worse, and if you ask questions about it she will only answer in an ambiguous way.  Class was very boring too.
Course content on race and gender was very interesting and provoked fascinating discussion.  Professor is very knowledgeable.
Prof. Zamora is a rigorous instructor who does not tolerate silliness. She will be one of the best professors you'll ever have, if you take her seriously - which you should!
Professor Zamora was excellent.  One of the best Spanish professors I have ever had.
I liked the professors style.  She was friendly and seemed passionate about the course material and education.
The course content was interesting and challenging. The instructor was very passionate about the subject matter.
I was one of the few people in the class who actually did the reading on a regular basis.

Honestly the worst professor I've ever had. Not a fair grader (there will be multiple questions on each test on things that were never mentioned), does not listen to your concerns, assigns wayyyyy too much reading, doesn't assign things til the day they're due... the list goes on and on. Seriously, do not take any class that she is teaching.

horrible teacher. very unapproachable. doesn't give barely any info on expectations of papers. takes forever to get stuff back to you, and when she does there is very little feedback. class is extremeley boring too

In class you just sit and listen to her talk about the text, sometimes she will ask for input and if she doesn't agree she will let you know.  Tests involve really knowing the material: she'll give you a term and you'll need to talk about it or an indepth analysis of a piece.  This class has not helped my spanish improve at all.

Zamora is a fair grader, but can take forever. She has a couple interesting stories (she had Borges for dinner at her house!), but for the most part is dry in class. I loved her, but that is more than I can say about the rest of the class.

not very clear on expectations for exams, lectures are ridiculously boring & filled with awkward silences, doesn't seem to care to help students (for example - not ONCE did she respond to my emails) AVOID ZAMORA AT ALL COSTS

Not a pleasant prof. Gives very vague information regarding the exams, which are difficult. Some of her grading seems unfair, but when I asked about it in office hours, she had no comment other than, that's how it is. I can't say I got much out of this class. Find a different professor please.

224 was an ok class, but zamora was always delayed in grading our coursework, wasn't clear on what was on the test, and the passiveness of the class was just a reflection of the passiveness of her....her monotonous tone, her constant sitting, and awkward silences that insued during class made going not fun.
